CAREGIVERS -T0-CAREGIVERS EDUCATION PROGRAM

Findings from Singapore Mental Health Study conducted by the Institute of Mental Health in 2010 revealed that the most common mental disorders are Major Depressive Disorder (1 in 17), Alcohol Abuse (1 in 32) and Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (1 in 33). Most mental disorders occur by the age of 29 and most people with mental illness do not seek help. This study indicates that there is a need for the community to reach out to the large number of caregivers who need support in caring for their loved one.

With this in mind, the Manager has engaged Caregivers Alliance Limited (CAL), a non-profit organisation in Singapore dedicated to meeting the needs of families and caregivers of people with mental illness to provide an eightâ€”session Caregivers-to-Caregivers Education Program to the staff.

This program provided the Managerâ€™s employees with the knowledge and skills to support and effectively interact with friends, family or colleagues who are suffering from mental illness. During the 8 weeksâ€™ training, employees had the opportunity to share the issues and challenges faced when acting as caregivers. The speaker gave useful advice about methods that can be used during the recoveryjourney of their loved one. The Caregiver course encouraged empathy and better understanding of those who are suffering from mental illnesses.
